transcripts.text: Operation Underground Railroad exists to rescue children from sex trafficking around the world.  Throughout history, slaves have had their heads shaved.  And slaves have always been forcefully having their identity taken away from them.  And so we wanted to shave our head because hair is a big part of our identity and our culture.  So we're showing that we can give up part of our identity to show support for the slaves.  My hair is really thick so it kind of hurt at first but after it's a really good feeling and especially seeing all the other people doing it because it's such an important cause.
I think every child deserves to have a great childhood.  And so being able to be a part of this cause that allows them to have that and live a better life, that's why I do it.
And the awareness that they're raising and the kids that they're helping, to me it just tells me that there's hope.  There's hope for these kids and there's hope for the future.
It's really honestly the kids here at Sky Ridge that inspired me to do even more.
We raised $2,200 for those kids and we shaved 78 heads.  It was amazing.  Be that one person.  Be the one person that's going to make the difference.
